aj:
Sound Library is a free collection of sound samples and generative music tools for Ableton Live.
This Sound Library contains 30 sample packs containing over 1800 samples of traditional instruments, extended technique, microtonality, spectralism, non-cochlear events, conceptual sound, studio outtakes, noise reduction artefacts, no-input mixer, rare synth units, secondhand-store vinyl, etc., plus a generative sample playback engine called "Seurat MIDI".

Recorded and developed by Jason Grier between 2013 and 2017. Used in live performances since 2013, now available free for public use.
Share what you've made using HEM SL! Send a link below, or email us a sl@hem.rocks
Music in a Petri Dish. Vito Acconci on Music and Language. Jeepneys on India Cooke. Rare tracks by Lucrecia Dalt, Line Gøttsche, Julia Holter and Michael Pisaro. New sounds in the Library

## UNCONVENTIONAL

![Wreckage of a piano found on the street in Berlin]({{ assetHost }}/hem-rocks/content/images/key-art/destroyed-piano.jpg "HEM Sound Library 2, Destroyed Piano")

SL2's sound design ethos is rooted in acousmatics, found sound, sonic detritus, extended technique, documentary, and audio forensics!

## PLAYABLE

![Hands playing instruments]({{ assetHost }}/hem-rocks/content/images/key-art/sl2-anim-bw.gif "HEM Sound Library 2 in action")

SL2 packs are meant to be _played_, with full keyboard spreads, dynamics control, and tactile parameters.

## CRITICAL

![Scrolling a smart text]({{ assetHost }}/hem-rocks/content/images/key-art/scrolling-article.gif "HEM Sound Library 2 article")

Each SL2 pack is sourced from sounds chosen for more than just design concerns, like ecomusicology, labor, activism, artistic research.

# React Javascript Consulting I specialise in devising strategies and practical implementations for you to migrate legacy systems to React in a smooth and nontoxic way. I love solving "the hard problems" elegantly and beautifully. [Django Logo - React Logo] [AngularJS Logo - React Logo] [Rails Logo - React Logo] [AngularJS Logo - React Logo] [Ember Logo - React Logo] [Vanilla JS - React Logo] ## TL;DR? Just get in touch: [EMAIL INPUT][SUBMIT] ## More about what I offer I engage with your team members to develop framework components, tooling architecture, and testing strategies. But moreover, I offer intensive mentoring and training. Not just a technical chore, but a level-up for your whole team. I have extensive experience in digital asset management, new media arts, and financial technology; and in major markets in the US, Germany, and the Nordics. Click [here](#rates) for rates. In addition to React migrations, I also offer general Javascript consulting, mentoring, and lessons a-la-carte: - Ethical analytics with matomo - Metaprogramming, parsing, and lexical scope - Advanced functional programming concepts - Using JSON-LD and GraphQL in Node - Python for Javascripters - Writing your own programming language - Writing your own Javascript framework - Or anything interesting and challenging that you can think of! ## Interested in Vue instead? I also do Vue! ## Recent React migrations: [MGM] [Lionsgate] [Amazon Studios] [mediapeers] [Billy] [Moneyflow] ## Case Study #1: Going from Angular 1 to React with Amazon Studios ## Case Study #2: Going from Ember to React with Billy ## Case Study #3: Going from Django to Vue with Moneyflow Company profile: Fastest-growing FinTech startup in Copenhagen, over xxx growth in 2020, xxx developers, Stack: Dramatiq/Python/Django/Vanilla JS ## My Rates I charge a flat rate: Migration to React or Vue: 12 000 USD per month A-la-carte consultation: 500 USD per day

# Bespoke React Developer

I focus on small—medium-sized projects for small businesses and individuals, especially nonprofits and cultural institutions.

I bring 10+ years of enterprise web development experience in Media, FinTech, Marketing, and so on.

I also bring 10+ years of experience running my own nonprofit cultural institution, which you can read about [here](/human-ear-music-jag).
